reviewText: Great learning more about the culture

N.S.McFarlane writes to Laura Tanna I am a Jamaican immigrant to the US. I came here quite young at 10 years old but I have great memories of these stories from my childhood. I am now the mother of 2 young children and these are treasures that I wish to share with them. I love to perform these stories for them. Their favorite is "Anansi's Old Riding Horse." What you have put together is remarkable and I can't wait to experience it at its fullest. With the passing of Louise Bennett and others of her generation, this kind of memory is being lost so it's gratifying to know that this book exists. I just gave this latest copy to my cousin who was not born in Jamaica so, like me, she craves this type of knowledge. My next purchase will be to get her a copy for my daughter's pre-school as a parting gift. Eventually I'll include their current elementary schools and other members of my family. I will definitely be a repeat customer. There are so many groups that can benefit from this book. It really made my day and I am so excited. I wish to wait for the CDs and DVD. Once you start your campaign, I will forward the information to everyone I can think of. Thanks again. N.S.McFarlane [DVD and CDs are now available on Amazon.com] Jamaican Folk Tales and Oral Histories Jamaican Folk Tales & Oral Histories DVD Jamaican Folk Tales & Oral Histories CD #1 Jamaican Folk Tales & Oral Histories CD #2/Maroon Storyteller
